result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kavell Lashawn Sims

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kavell Lashawn Sims in court, in custody.  Attorney Amy M Johnson, by phone and attorney Tracey Lencioni in court for Kavell Lashawn Sims.  Attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for State of Wisconsin. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on October 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Setover request of hearings 9-22-22 filed by Atty Johnson

Preliminary Hearing was set. 

09:07 AM Defendant Kavell Lashawn Sims in court. Prosecuting Atty Lexi Keyes appeared for State of Wisconsin. Approved for SPD, no appointment yet.  Defendant waived timelimites.  Court will set for a STC.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
ZOOM
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with his co-defendant Mr. Gray.
 - Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)].
  Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 11

03:23 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
